org.validator.services.metadata

Class Repository

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.validator.services.metadata.Repository

  • public class Repository
extends java.lang.Object
    A basic class to handle the metadata repository file. Repository files were handled through File calls, making the code in the ValidatorService and ValidatorEngine too verbose and difficult to follow.
    Author:
    danielgalassi@gmail.com

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.File directory
      The session directory where the XUDML file is stored.
      private static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger 
      private java.io.File repository
      The metadata file in XUDML (XML) format stored in the filesystem under the session directory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Repository(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String repository, java.lang.String selectedSubjectArea)
      Instantiates a metadata file and trims the mammoth file keeping only XUDML tags related to the selected subject area.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean available()
      Evaluates the status of the file.
      java.io.File toFile()
      Returns a file representing the repository.
      void trim(java.lang.String keepSubjectArea)
      Creates a smaller repository file discarding all objects not used for the selected Subject Area.

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger

      • repository

        private java.io.File repository
        The metadata file in XUDML (XML) format stored in the filesystem under the session directory.

      • directory

        private java.io.File directory
        The session directory where the XUDML file is stored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Repository

        public Repository(java.lang.String directory,
          java.lang.String repository,
          java.lang.String selectedSubjectArea)
        Instantiates a metadata file and trims the mammoth file keeping only XUDML tags related to the selected subject area.
        Parameters:
        directory - path to the repository metadata file
        repository - name and extension of the metadata repository file
        selectedSubjectArea - the name of the subject area selected from the combo box

    • Method Detail

      • available

        public boolean available()
        Evaluates the status of the file.
        Returns:
        true if the file if found and can be read

      • trim

        public void trim(java.lang.String keepSubjectArea)
        Creates a smaller repository file discarding all objects not used for the selected Subject Area. While the code in this method and classes this method calls can handle processing a number of subject areas, at the moment, the functionality of the application is limited to a single subject area.
        Parameters:
        keepSubjectArea - the name of the subject area to evaluate

      • toFile

        public java.io.File toFile()
        Returns a file representing the repository.
        Returns:
        a File reference to the repository file
